meanings.sent1: She sufflated the balloon to make it bigger.
meanings.sent2: He sufflated the tire with air before the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The clown sufflated the glove to create a funny squeaky sound.
meanings.sent4: His words sufflated hope into her heart.
meanings.sent5: The wind sufflated the sails, propelling the boat forward.

meanings.definition: To fill with air or gas
meanings.sent1: The scuba diver sufflated his tank before diving.
meanings.sent2: The chef sufflated the pastry dough to make it light and fluffy.
meanings.sent3: The prankster sufflated the whoopee cushion, waiting for the perfect moment.
meanings.sent4: Laughter sufflated the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon was sufflated with gas for the flight.

meanings.sent1: The firefighter sufflated fresh air into the burning building.
meanings.sent2: She sufflated warmth into her cold hands.
meanings.sent3: The child sufflated bubbles into the soapy water, giggling.
meanings.sent4: Music sufflated life into the party.
meanings.sent5: The singer sufflated emotion into every note she sang.
